thread.title: MORENO VALLEY: Vandals damage 40 cars in overnight crime spree
thread.title_full: MORENO VALLEY: Vandals damage 40 cars in overnight crime spree - Press Enterprise

author: PATRICK ONEILL
title: MORENO VALLEY: Vandals damage 40 cars in overnight crime spree
text:
BY PATRICK ONEILL 4, 2015 Updated: 4:45 p.m. MORENO VALLEY: Vandals damage 40 cars in overnight crime spree Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article » A 19-year-old Moreno Valley man was arrested Sunday, Oct. 4, after police there say he and two other people vandalized dozens of cars by shooting them with a BB gun.
Brendan Griffis, one of three primary suspects and the only one identified, is being held on suspicion of vandalism, a Riverside County Sheriff’s Department news release states.
Moreno Valley police say between midnight and 6:45 a.m., Griffis and the other suspects shot at the windows of at least 40 cars north of Highway 60 between Kitching Street and Pigeon Pass Road, causing approximately $10,000 worth of damage.
Investigators have confiscated two BB guns, along with several boxes of ammunition and CO2 cartridges.
Anyone with information about the crime is urged to call Officer Cisneros at the Moreno Valley Police Department at 951-486-6700, or 951-247-8700.
